title: Boris Johnson: My mother voted Leave
text:
Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson at the annual Conservative Party conference | Paul Ellis/AFP via Getty Images Boris Johnson: My mother voted Leave ‘I didn’t know that,’ says father Stanley Johnson.

The Johnson family is already divided over Brexit — and now it's even worse.

Prime Minister Boris Johnson told the Conservative conference in Manchester that his mother voted to leave the European Union in the 2016 referendum.

"I want you to know, conference, that I have kept my ace up my sleeve ... my mother voted Leave," he said to applause.

The TV cameras then focused on Johnson's father Stanley, who was seen saying to Johnson's partner Carrie Symonds: "I didn't know that."

.@BorisJohnson tells the Tory Party Conference his mother voted leave, before his dad Stanley can been seen to say 'I didn't know that' https://t.co/RRA2V9x9sI pic.twitter.com/iPXwxupb95 — ITV News (@itvnews) October 2, 2019

Boris Johnson was a leading figure in the Leave campaign, but Jo Johnson, the prime minister's younger brother, stepped down as science and universities minister and as a Tory member of parliament last month because of “unresolvable tension” over Brexit.

Rachel Johnson, the PM's sister, has called the PM's comments on Brexit "highly reprehensible." Stanley Johnson was an MEP and worked at the European Commission. He supported Remain in the 2016 referendum but later said he had changed his mind.

Johnson's mother is Charlotte Johnson Wahl, an artist whose own father was James Fawcett, a former president of the European Commission for Human Rights (not the other European Commission).
description: ‘I didn’t know that,’ says father Stanley Johnson.
